comments.body: Better to define what the default is
I like it to not explicit define the default (because the SQL command will increase in that case and it is not necessary) and just say that this is the "implicit" default
I changed it to only have the option `CASCADE`. I removed the implicit default option `RESTRICT`.

comments.body:
```suggestion
class Sequence(object):

    """Maybe docstrings for classes and methods using PEP257
    
    ...
    """

```
It's just a proposal. I can do it by myself later but you would do it faster as an author than me.

```suggestion
    sequence = Sequence(module, cursor)
```
One cosmetic suggestion. I used the name data for the object in postgresql_copy because of it works with data. You can leave it as it is if you like

Yes you are right, I liked a shorter name and `sequence` is already used many times in the code, so it is also confusing. I just leave it so :)
Thanks for the review!
Nps:)

    # Set defaults:

comments.body: Why have both `schema` and `newschema`? I would assume that if I specify another value for `schema`, that the schema will be changed.

Yes and no ;)
If you specify a sequence in an other schema then public, it will be difficult to find this sequence if you use only `schema` for the new schema name. Therefor I would prefer to use `newschema` for setting a new schema to a existing sequence.
Are you okay with that?
Sure. But then you should really adjust the documentation, because right now it seems that `schema` is only needed for creation, not for actually finding back the sequence.
